propertyGroup.name: Outlets
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: wsdls
property.documentation: Specifies the directory to which generated WSDL's will be placed.

property.name: java-types
property.documentation: The directory to which any non implementation Java files will be generated.

property.name: configuration
property.documentation: The directory to which any configuration files are generated (such as the web.xml, etc).

property.name: axis-tests
property.documentation: The directory to which AXIS specific test classes are generated.

property.name: axis-test-impls
property.documentation: The directory to which the AXIS specific test implementation classes are generated.

property.name: wss4j-configuration
property.documentation: The directory to which any WSS4J specific configuration files are generated.

property.name: webservice-types
property.documentation: The directory to which any extra webservice classes will be generated (i.e. an AttachmentHandler for example).

property.name: webservice-impl
property.documentation: The directory to which any extra webservice classes will be generated (i.e. an AttachmentHandler for example).

property.name: service-impls
property.documentation: The directory to which any service implementation classes will be generated.

property.name: jaxb-impl
property.documentation: The directory to which customized JAXB implementation classes will be generated (i.e. Adapter).

property.name: jaxb-gen
property.documentation: The directory to which JAXB generated classes will be generated (i.e. package-info, ObjectFactory), and to which CXF client generated classes will be copied.

property.name: generateRefFiles
property.documentation: Generates File.ref files if overwrite=false for a template output. Ref files contain what would have been generated to the original file if overwrite=true or if the file did not already exist. Can be used to replace or merge with the exiting file.

property.name: overwriteAll
property.documentation: Overwrite all files when generating output. Default=false. Use for project testing where all output will overwritten.

property.name: axisVersion
property.documentation:
The version of Axis to use when generating (if using axis). Allowable values are:
1 - Axis 1.x
2 - Axis 2.x

property.name: soapStack
property.documentation:
The soap stack to use for your webservices, valid values are:
axis
xfire
jaxws
cxf

property.name: soapVersion
property.documentation:
The soap version to use for your webservices, default=1.1, valid values are:
1.1
1.2

property.name: cxfVersion
property.documentation:
The cxf version to use for your webservices, default=2.0, determined by pom.xml property cxf.version used to determine if java2ws should be run instead of java2wsdl, and if custom adapter classes can be referenced by the jaxb bindings files. Valid values are:
2.0
2.1

property.name: webserviceTypesPackage
property.documentation: The package to which extra types are generated (i.e. AttachmentHandler).

property.name: extensionInheritanceDisabled
property.documentation: Whether or not inheritance using XSD extensions is disabled. If true - inheritance is "faked" in that an object inheriting from another will include its inherited properties (it will be flatted) in its WSDL schema definition.

property.name: attachmentsDirectory
property.documentation: The directory where attachments end up. This should be in the syntax appropriate for the target platform.

property.name: namespacePrefix
property.documentation: Defines the prefix to give to the default namespace. Can be customized for individual services through WebService stereotype.

property.name: qualifiedNameLocalPartPattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when a qualified name local part is created. {0} represents the name of the classifier (i.e. WS{0} would give all your types and services a prefix of WS).

property.name: namespacePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when a namespace is created. {0} represents the reversed package name of the classifier (i.e. ws.{0} would prefix all your type and service namespaces with ws.).

property.name: reverseNamespace
property.documentation:
Whether or not to reverse the ordering of the namespace. The namespace is typically determined by the package name of the service or type, this allows you to reverse the package name. (i.e. org.andromda.samples would become samples.andromda.org if this was set to true). Possible values are:
true
false

property.name: defaultProvider
property.documentation:
The default use given all web services (if not defined separately on each web service). Possible choices are:
RPC
EJB
JAX-WS

property.name: defaultStyle
property.documentation:
The default style given all web services (if not defined separately on each web service). Can be customized for individual services through WebService stereotype. Possible choices are:
wrapped
document
rpc

property.name: defaultUse
property.documentation:
The default use given all web services (if not defined separately on each web service). Can be customized for individual services through WebService stereotype. Possible choices are:
literal
encoded

property.name: defaultParameterStyle
property.documentation:
The default parameter encoding style for a webservice operation. Can be customized for individual services through WebService stereotype. Possible choices are:
wrapped
bare

property.name: rpcClassNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use for the class name for a web service using an RPC provider. It's useful to set this when your RPC service has a non typical name (i.e. you want to use the web service delegator from the spring cartridge). {0} is the service package name and {1} is the service class name.

property.name: wsdlOperationSortMode
property.documentation: Specifies how operations should be sorted within the WSDL. Current options are none and name.

property.name: testPackageNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the package name to which tests are generated, where {0} is the current model element package name.

property.name: testNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the name's of the tests that should be generated, where {0} is the current model element name.

property.name: testImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern used to construct the test implementation name, where {0} is the current model element name.

property.name: arrayNamePrefix
property.documentation: Specifies the prefix to give to names of WSDL array elements.

property.name: schemaTypeMappingsUri
property.documentation: URI specifying the specific mappings from UML model types to WSDL Schema types. (i.e. file:${basedir}/XmlSchemaMappings.xml)

property.name: ejbJndiNamePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix given to the JNDI name of the EJB provider. This may be specified by another cartridge (i.e. the Hibernate cartridge, EJB cartridge, etc.) so it must be specified here in order to give the correct JNDI name of an EJB provider.

property.name: ejbInterfacePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when determining the interface of an EJB provider: {0} represents the package name of the model element and {1} represents the name of the model element.

property.name: ejbHomeInterfacePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when determining the home interface of an EJB provider: {0} represents the package name of the model element and {1} represents the name of the model element.

property.name: testImplementationOperationNamePrefix
property.documentation: The pattern used to construct the test implementation name, where {0} is the current model element name.

property.name: applicationName
property.documentation: The name of the application that this service will run within (i.e. Security Services}

property.name: wsdlSoapAddress
property.documentation: The location of where the WSDL will reside (i.e. "http://localhost:8080/security-service/services")

property.name: securityRealm
property.documentation: The security realm to use for securing your web service(s). NOTE: this must be set in order to have ANY of your web services secured. A web service will be secured if it has any roles (i.e. Actors) have dependencies to it.

property.name: testServiceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the test service locator.

property.name: testServiceLocatorPackage
property.documentation: The package to give the test service locator.

property.name: servicesPath
property.documentation: The path to the location of the services (relative to the web application context).

property.name: webContext
property.documentation: The web application context path http://host:port/webContext/servicesPath/ServiceName.

property.name: ejbJndiUrl
property.documentation: The JNDI url to use when using EJB as your web service provider.

property.name: ejbNamingContextFactory
property.documentation: The JNDI context factory to use when using EJB as your web service provider.

property.name: sessionTimeout
property.documentation: The number of minutes the session can be idle before timeout occurs.

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.documentation: Encoding for generated XML files.

property.name: generateMethodImpl
property.documentation: Generate a class with service method implementation, with default/dummy values for the entire service complex hierarchy.

property.name: useArrayWrapper
property.documentation: For CXF web services, do not wrap arrays with ArrayOf class in wsdl.

property.name: useAttributes
property.documentation: Output WSDL simple types as attributes instead of elements. Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAttribute stereotype.

property.name: useEventLogger
property.documentation: Use EventLogger for logging within WS Test Client files.

property.name: makeNillable
property.documentation: For associations of multiplicity 0, and non-required elements, output schema with nillable=true, otherwise use minOccurs=0

property.name: importedXSD
property.documentation: wsdl files import external xsd files instead of embedding schemas within wsdl. Requires 'XmlSchema' stereotype on package containing ValueObject classes, to generate xsd files containing elements from that package.

property.name: validateSchema
property.documentation: Validate the incoming XML against the wsdl/xsd schema globally. Can be turned on/off for an individual service through XmlSchema stereotype schemaValidation taggedValue.

property.name: webserviceHost
property.documentation: Webservice hostname used for CXF client and wsdl configurations

property.name: webservicePort
property.documentation: Webservice port used for CXF client and wsdl configurations

property.name: persistenceContainerName
property.documentation:
The default persistence container engine name. Used when specifying specific annotations for different persistence containers. Possible values are:
jboss
weblogic
ibm

property.name: enableAnnotations
property.documentation: Indicates whether JDK5 annotations will be generated.

property.name: generateIsBooleanGetters
property.documentation: When set to 'true' the cartridge will generate an IsAttribute(..) method for each Boolean/boolean attribute in addition to the normal getAttribute method. Jaxb/Jax-ws only generates IsAttribute() methods for webservice client objects, this is needed for ValueObject method compatibility. Set to true when cxf webservice option is selected for new application generation.

property.name: generateChainedSetters
property.documentation: When set to 'true' the setAttribute method returns 'this' instead of void, allowing setter methods to be chained together after the constructor for improved readability and reduced lines of code. For example: Type variable = new Type().setAttribute1(value1).setAttribute2(value2); etc

property.name: simpleBindingMode
property.documentation: Adds xjc:simple to Jaxb2.1 binding file options. Described in http://weblogs.java.net/blog/kohsuke/archive/2006/03/simple_and_bett.html and in https://jaxb.dev.java.net/2.1.2/docs/vendorCustomizations.html. Makes all elements @XMLRootElement, pluralizes attribute/association/parameter names of multiplicity *. Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAdapter stereotype.

property.name: xjcArguments
property.documentation: Add additional CXF xjc arguments to the wsdl2java command, to customize the Jaxb2 generated classes. XJC plugins are available under Jaxb2 Commons: https://jaxb2-commons.dev.java.net . The default XJC arguments value does not require downloading any Jaxb commons plugins. Plugins must be added to CXF_HOME\lib directory or JAXB_HOME\commons directory. Suggested value: -Xcommons-lang,-Xcommons-lang:ToStringStyle=DEFAULT_STYLE,-Xdefault-value,-Xvalue-constructor,-Xcollection-setter-injector,-simple-preserve" Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAdapter stereotype. />

property.name: XMLDateAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Date<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar instead of XMLGregorianCalendar. Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAdapter stereotype.

property.name: XMLDateTimeAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Date<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar instead of XMLGregorianCalendar. Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAdapter stereotype.

property.name: XMLTimeAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Date<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs java.util.Date or java.util.Calendar instead of XMLGregorianCalendar. Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAdapter stereotype.

property.name: XMLBooleanAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Boolean<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs Boolean instead of boolean. Primitive boolean can cause issues with XML return values. Example: com.disney.jaxb.adapter.BooleanAdapter. Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAdapter stereotype.

property.name: XMLIntegerAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Integer<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs Integer instead of BigInteger. Example: com.disney.jaxb.adapter.IntegerAdapter. Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAdapter stereotype.

property.name: XMLDecimalAdapter
property.documentation: Class which extends Jaxb2 javax.xml.bind.annotation.adapters.XmlAdapter>String, Decimal<. Handles parse/print of customized String formats. Outputs Decimal instead of BigDecimal. Example: com.disney.jaxb.adapter.LongAdapter. Can be customized for individual attributes through XmlAdapter stereotype.

propertyGroup.name: Axis2
propertyGroup.documentation: These properties are specific for Axis2 support.

property.name: axis2WrappedMessageReceiver
property.documentation: The message receiver used in the Axis2 service.xml for "wrapped" style services. If this is not specified, the wrapped message receiver generated by this cartridge is used.

property.name: axis2DefaultMessageReceiver
property.documentation: The message receiver used for any services other than "wrapped" style.

property.name: axis2GeneratedWrappedMessageReceiverRendersFaultsAsBeans
property.documentation: When the generated wrapped message receiver is being used it will render faults as strong-typed beans into the 'details' section of the SOAP body. Exceptions from the JDK will only have their 'message' and 'stackTrace' properties rendered, while custom exceptions only include the properties which have been modeled on them. Setting this property to 'false' will have each exception rendered as a plaintext Axis fault in which you will only find the stacktrace.

propertyGroup.name: XFire
propertyGroup.documentation: These properties are specific for XFire support.

property.name: springVersion
property.documentation:
The version of Spring being used. Valid values are:
1
2

propertyGroup.name: WSS4J
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the properties for configuring support for WSS4J generation.

property.name: signedRequest
property.documentation: True or false on whether or not the webservice will expect signed requests. If true, a WSS4J Axis handler will be added to provide decryption of signed requests (if this is set to true the following properties below MUST be specified.

property.name: encryptedRequest
property.documentation: If true, causes generation of necessary code to that expects the request to be encrypted

property.name: encryptedResponse
property.documentation: If true, causes generation of necessary code that encrypts the response.

property.name: signedResponse
property.documentation: If true, causes generation of necessary code that signs the response.

property.name: cryptoKeyStore
property.documentation: The location of the key store file (i.e. keys/authorization-service.jks).

property.name: cryptoKeyStoreType
property.documentation: The key store's type (i.e. jks).

property.name: cryptoKeyStoreAlias
property.documentation: The key store alias name.

property.name: cryptoAliasPassword
property.documentation: The alias password.

property.name: cryptoKeyStorePassword
property.documentation: The key store password.
